verses.roman:
sa cukrośāhinā grastaḥ
kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa mahān ayam
sarpo māṁ grasate tāta
prapannaṁ parimocaya

synonyms: saḥ—he, Nanda Mahārāja; cukrośa—shouted; ahinā—by the snake; grastaḥ—seized; kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa—O Kṛṣṇa, Kṛṣṇa; mahān—large; ayam—this; sarpaḥ—serpent; mām—me; grasate—is swallowing; tāta—my dear boy; prapannam—who is surrendered; parimocaya—please deliver.
translation: In the clutches of the snake, Nanda Mahārāja cried out, "Kṛṣṇa, Kṛṣṇa, my dear boy! This huge serpent is swallowing me! Please save me, who am surrendered to You!"
